medical_history.chief_complaint: One day of abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain began the previous afternoon and initially felt like bloating/gas pain. After several hours, the pain increased in sensitivity and was described as cramping in the epigastric region that did not radiate. Shortly after the onset of pain, the patient began to feel nauseated and started vomiting, with subjective fevers reported at that time. Vomit was non-bloody and non-bilious. The patient experienced episodes of abdominal pain, although not as severe, frequently during/after eating for roughly a month.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Asthma, COPD, Aortic insufficiency, Back pain, Glucose intolerance, Multinodular goiter, Sleep apnea, Occasional GERD, Seasonal and environmental allergies including to cats. Recently diagnosed with lupus and started on prednisone/hydroxychloroquine one month ago.
medical_history.family_history: Sister and son with asthma; maternal grandmother and aunt with diabetes; father with throat cancer.
